page.title: 05HOUSING IN NORTH SHEFFIELD
page.content: This area is{largely residential with some industry, mainly small businesses but with two or three large engineering firms. The housing of the area has been mainly built on the slopes of several steep hills with the industry being mainly located in the river valley. Houses are predominantly terraced, built before the first world war, although more modern houses appear on two later council estates. There are several tower blocks in the Upperthorpe area and one huge complex of council flats known as the{Kelvin {Flats.}There is also a large block of private flats known as Regency Court near to Hillsborough shopping centre. Much of the remaining terraced Victorian housing has been renovated but the poorer housing has been demolished.
